attributes.action: Increase School Funding to local authorities and Stop the Education Cuts.
attributes.background: Over the last two years schools have been forced to reduce the number of school support staff owing to unprecedented cuts in the Government support grant.Those taking the hardest cuts are school support staff who are either made redundant or have to do more by having extra duties without recognition
attributes.additional_details:
Schools should have more than the current funding settlement and the freedom to employ the right level of support staff appropriate to the needs of their pupils with the drive to improve education standards.
They are the backbone of our education system and should be treated with respect. They help the most vulnerable children and schools cannot function without them. As a consequence, many children would struggle and leave school without the qualifications and skills needed in adulthood.

attributes.action: Stop the Iraq Fatality Investigations (IFI).
attributes.background: The Iraq Fatalities Investigations were set up by the MoD to look into allegations made against UK armed forces personnel in Iraq.  Many of these allegations have been investigated several times already, placing intolerable strain on soldiers and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
As an example, Major Robert Campbell has already been investigated seven times for an incident alleged to have occurred in Iraq 2003. Each time there has been no case to answer.

Having spent his entire career helping others, providing water and shelter as a Royal Engineer and clearing mines, IEDs and bombs as a Bomb Disposal Officer he deserves better.

As he reaches retirement from the Service as a disabled Servicemen, he is now threatened with another investigation.  This must stop.

attributes.action: Keep freedom of movement for UK and EU Citizens as part of Brexit EU trade deal
attributes.background: The Leave side won the EU referendum in 2016, but there are voters on both sides who wish to keep EU freedom of movement rights post Brexit.  Freedom of movement is also essential for the NHS and companies across the UK and EU, we must fight to maintain it. Please sign if you agree.
attributes.additional_details: As the March 29th 2019 Brexit withdrawal deadline draws ever closer we must act before it's too late to save Freedom of movement rights for UK and EU Citizens post Brexit.  Think about the future and the opportunities that EU freedom of movement rights offer with the ability to work, live, study and retire across the EU 28.

attributes.action: Make the wearing of cycle helmets for children law.
attributes.background: Wearing my cycle helmet saved my life! It protected my head when I hit the road and from the hot exhaust when I was trapped under the car. The helmet was amazing as it was damaged and melted but still intact. Now I want all children to have to wear helmets.
attributes.additional_details:
My accident happened while cycling to school. I came off my bike head first, landing in front of a car, which drove over me, trapping me beneath. The air ambulance attended and I was flown to hospital. I sustained three breaks, a fracture and lost some teeth. 

The consultant said I wouldn't have survived without a helmet.  

I want you all to understand it can happen to anyone....as it happened to me!

attributes.action: Make it the law for all cats to be microchipped
attributes.background: The microchipping of dogs became UK law back in 2016. I am calling for the same protection to be given to cats. Each year hundreds of thousands of cats are injured, lost and killed on our roads, a high percentage of which are often not microchipped. Of the ones that survive, many end up in shelters

attributes.action: Introduce proper effective regulation of implantable medical devices
attributes.background:
Repeated scandals involving medical devices show that the current regulatory system is not fit for purpose
Tighten regulation of medical devices so that:
- High risk medical devices have clinical trial evidence at the time of approval
- There is a publicly accessible registry for such devices
attributes.additional_details:
There have been multiple scandals over implanted medical devices, including pacemakers, TVT meshes, breast implants, & metal hip joints.

Current rules mean manufacturers don't have to produce clinical trial evidence before CE safety marking & use in patients. Equivalence allows a new device to be waved through if a manufacturer declares it similar to an existing product, even if those other products have had safety concerns.

Reference: BMJ Open 2017;7:e017125
doi: 10.1136/bmjopen-2017-017125

attributes.action: Abolish the killing of stray animals in Council shelters!
attributes.background: Currently it is legal for Council shelters to destroy stray dogs, cats etc. in 7 days if they are not reclaimed or taken in by a rescue such as Dog's Trust, Cats Protection or another animal charity!
attributes.additional_details: I would like the Government to abolish the killing of animals in Council shelters, turn them into People's Rescues and afford them charity status, so as the public can keep these animals alive via contributions!

attributes.action: Release the 'Implementation Unit Report on Shale Gas' (2016) immediately.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, demand that the above report is published unredacted to allow full scrutiny of all relevant issues by The Communities and Local Government (CLG) Select Committee inquiry into fracking, and to inform the public consultation on the draft National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF).
attributes.additional_details: In response to FOI requests by Sir Kevin Barron MP for this secret report to be made public, the Cabinet Office acknowledged that “decisions ministers make regarding fracking may have a significant impact on the lives of citizens.” However, the government refuse to publish this report on the grounds that doing so “could call into question the industry’s viability." We believe the public has a right to know what the government is withholding from the public. Read more here: https://goo.gl/Wbsg1r

attributes.action: Reinstate the rail link from Poulton le Fylde to Fleetwood Lancashire
attributes.background: The rail link was closed in 1980’s. There is a need in Fleetwood for decent transport links on the grounds of deprivation and poor economy. People have to travel for an hour during rush hour to get to the nearest station 5 miles away. Commuter rail is essential to rebuild our economy.
attributes.additional_details: Fleetwood is on a peninsula and since the 1970’s has been in decline. We now have a division one football club, the only one with no rail link, and things are on the up though people cannot get in and out of town for university and work due to its positioning on the Fylde coast. We are a beautiful town with an amazing coastline which we cannot share properly due to poor transport links. Most of the track is in place just no trains running. Fleetwood has great potential please help it thrive.

attributes.action: Make access to habitable shelter a protected and inalienable human right
attributes.background:
The homeless crisis in the UK is not caused by a lack of housing, but by access to housing being denied to homeless people.
We demand that access to habitable shelter be recognised as a human right, so that action can be taken to end homelessness immediately - with no one left out.
attributes.additional_details:
According to Shelter, over 300,000 people are homeless in the UK - in temporary accommodation, sleeping on the streets or in cars.
There are over 200,000 long-term empty homes in the UK (www.emptyhomes.com/assets/2017-10-17-empty-homes-press-release.pdf).
Even with just 2 bedrooms per home, that's enough to house everyone and end homelessness immediately.
However, since the right to own empty properties and second homes beats other people's rights to a home, access to those homes is denied.

attributes.action: Clarify the term "Railway Land" of the Lynn and Fakenham Railway Acts 1876/81
attributes.background: The Whitwell & Reepham Railway Preservation Society are a Heritage Railway and have been running for over 10 years. We would like to relay track on an old track bed running from Whitwell & Reepham Station to Lenwade Station, making sure the existing users can still use the land as well.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like the Government to
1) clarify the position of the Lynn and Fakenham Railway Act of 1876 to 1881, the Eastern & Midlands Act 1883 to 1885, and the other railway almaganations up to Network Rail times, and to confirm the land under the Lynn and Fakenham Act still does in fact have an act of parliament still in force for the land to be used as a railway
2) clarify who actually has preference over this land if the point above is true.
3) Provide us with a written statement of the above

attributes.action: Licence the use of Air Rifles
attributes.background:
Swan Support 
We are a swan rescue organisation who rescue sick and injured swans within the Thames Valley and surrounding areas.The calls relating to swans that have been shot with air rifles has increased exponentially in recent months.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like air rifle ownership to become a licensed requirement, resulting in a more severe penalty for misuse or use without a valid license.Swans mate for life, so when one is lost to this barbaric and torturous tactic the mate and offspring do not thrive.Swans are an important species in naturally balancing our eco-system by playing a vital role in keeping our wild areas viable & enriched.We, (and the swans), would truly value your support in helping reduce this heinous practice.
Thank You

attributes.action: Make the Early Years Teacher Status on par with the Qualified Teacher Status
attributes.background: The EYFS (0-5 years) is a crucial part of a child's life which requires careful and considered teaching. Early Years Teacher Status is not recognised as a teaching qualification in state schools but rather an unqualified teacher and therefore impacts on both pay and job opportunities in schools.
attributes.additional_details: In order to gain Early Years Teacher Status, an individual must complete a teaching portfolio which covers all 8 teaching standards alongside completing 120 days on placement in a variety of settings and 12 days in Key Stage 1 and 2. To complete all of the above and not be regarded as a teacher is demoralising to the hard graft that is put into our early years education system. The pay gap between an EYT and a QT is also shameful, emphasising the lack of respect for early years workers.

attributes.action: Save our pets from death on the roads Don't Ban Containment Systems
attributes.background: The Government has started a consultation on banning electronic training aids for cats and dogs. It is vital that containment systems do not get caught up in any ban. These systems save the lives of thousands of cats and dogs each year. Over 250,000 cats & countless dogs are run over on our roads.
attributes.additional_details: In 2007 DEFRA commissioned a study into the use of Electronic Pulse Training Aids. This study specifically excluded containment fences. The highly regarded Companion Animal Welfare Council's in-depth study of June 2012 concluded that it was not possible to formulate an evidence-based argument against the use of Electric Pulse Training Aids (EPTAs). In 2016 research from Lincoln University into cat containment "No evidence of long-term welfare problems with electronic containment of cats"

attributes.action: Introduce sanctions to STOP anonymous, false & malicious complaints to Ofsted.
attributes.background:
For too long those in the education & care sector have been at the mercy of disgruntled employees and/or families who are able to make anonymous, malicious & false complaints to Ofsted. 
The impact can be detrimental to the organisation involved & is costing the UK tax payer unnecessarily.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact on the organisation can be detrimental if the malicious complaint becomes public. Resulting in a tarnished reputation and/or closure of a service in come instances.

We are petitioning for Ofsted & the Government to introduce fines to those making false & malicious complaints. 
This means no more anonymous complaints can be received. 

This change will safeguard organisations, save money & help tighten up Ofsted's complaints procedures.

attributes.action: Proscribe Britain First
attributes.background: Britain First are an ultra far right group, they have a paramilitary wing called the "Britain First Defence Force". They organise ‘days of action’ that target a specific demographic namely Muslims, they use these days of actions to harass Muslims in shops, on the street or in mosques.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of its campaigners have also been banned from every mosque in England and Wales for their actions.
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/britain-first-banned-from-all-mosques-in-england-and-wales-after-police-take-out-injunction-a7196831.html

attributes.action: Introduce seller identity check and records of item for cash for gold shops
attributes.background:
There have been nationwide burglaries targeting Asian families perceived due to Asian families having Gold in their houses.
The burglaries can be life threatening.
Police have difficulty in finding the stolen items and as gold can be cashed in easily after melting.
attributes.additional_details:
Asian families are seen to be targeted for gold in their homes.
New controls be put in place to oblige the buyers of gold for cash to establish the identity of the seller, information of the source of the object, a requirement to retain the item at the outlet and to record the transaction, as well as provide police with access to items and records.
Police should be given  adequate powers of access, questioning, 
arrest .

There are similar laws in Australia and Ireland .

attributes.action: Exempt Radio Amateur aerials from requiring planning permission.
attributes.background: Current planning regulations severely restrict the ability of licensed Radio Amateurs to erect experimental aerial systems. We the undersigned require the government to amend the law to exempt all licensed Radio Amateurs (and C.B. radio users) from requiring planning permission for their aerials.
attributes.additional_details: Amateur Radio is a fantastic hobby for those who wish to learn about electronics and radio; and it can provide emergency communications when other systems fail. The experimental nature of the hobby allows people to design and build their own radios and aerial systems. Unfortunately, erect any kind of aerial and there is a chance you will be required to apply for planning permission. Change the aerial for a new design, and you will be back to square one. Planning law needs to change!

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that new borns have a heart scan before leaving hospital
attributes.background: Lots of new born babies are sent home from hospital with serious heart problems, which, are not known about until it’s too late. My youngest son was sent home with heart defects which were not picked up until he was two weeks old & required surgery almost immediately. This could’ve been prevented.
attributes.additional_details: When we were in the specialist heart hospital, there were many children coming in, with a late diagnosis. This can be very fatal and stressful. We didn’t know anything about the heart so we had to learn about this too. Having a heart scan like an echo would detect any problems or issues. The faster it’s picked up, the better. Specialists can be involved straight away with the correct care needed. An echo will take 15 mins. I would rather spend 15 mins extra knowing my child’s heart was healthy.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to offer a Vegan option in KS1 free school meals.
attributes.background: Currently schools will provide meals for children, who are following vegetarian diets, have allergies and avoid foods due to faith, but they do not provide a Vegan option and some Children who wish to follow a vegan diet are not able to. It should be law that schools provide vegan options.
attributes.additional_details: Some schools will accommodate and adjust meals for vegan children, this is not standard in all schools and some parents are told to provide packed lunches, Schools will provide a vegetarian and meat option, excluding vegan children from participating in school dinners. Children should have the choice to be able to choose a vegan option on the menu, everyday. No child should ever feel left out because of a life choice they have made, veganism should be widely accessible to all children.

attributes.action: Reduce the content covered at GCSE History so that only 3 Units are studied.
attributes.background: The new History GCSE only caters for the higher ability students and covers over 1200 years of study. There is far too much to cover to do any of the topics justice, regardless of exam board. A limit of 3 units of study needs to be imposed to ensure these units can be taught effectively.

attributes.action: Investigate whether David Davis lied to Parliament about Impact Assessments
attributes.background:
David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out impact reports detailing the financial impact of Brexit on the UK economy.

However these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2016, Secretary of State for Exiting the EU David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out “about 57 sets of analyses”. These would detail the financial impact of Brexit on sectors vital to the UK economy.
 
On 6th December 2017, David Davis admitted that these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.

attributes.action: Make our NHS hospital wards and waiting rooms across the UK infertile friendly.
attributes.background: There are 3.5m people affected by infertility in the UK. Yet their experience of our hospitals & surgeries only add to their grief and pain. Women who have suffered miscarriage, hysterectomies, gynae operations etc are placed in maternity wards/waiting rooms surrounded by pregnant women & babies.
attributes.additional_details:
We are asking for:
•  Separate rooms where women can wait for appointments away from pregnant women, babies and pregnancy poster campaigns 
•  Separate wards for women miscarrying their babies away from pregnant women, babies and maternity wards
•  Separate rooms or wards for young women having had hysterectomies away from early pregnancy departments or maternity wards
•  New legislation that means all NHS departments and GP surgeries provide safe environments for the infertile

attributes.action: Abolish ASPA Section 24, the secrecy clause for animals used in UK laboratories
attributes.background: Four years after the Government undertook a public consultation review of Section 24 of the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986, the results are yet to be published. Animals continue to suffer and be subjected to inhumane procedures in UK labs, shielded from public scrutiny by this clause.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 24 contradicts the UK’s right to freedom of information and is at odds with commitments to transparency and public accountability within EU Directive 2010/63 on animals in research. Its repeal was widely supported by the House of Lords Select Committee and Animal Procedures Committee. Only abolition will allow public bodies access to challenge licences and decrease the unnecessary suffering of animals in the name of research.
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/research-and-testing-using-animals

attributes.action: Stop explosive housing growth without infrastructure to support it
attributes.background: We call on the government to: (a) change planning laws and emphasis so that adequate infrastructure has to be provided alongside new homes; (b) provide grant funding where developer contributions alone are not enough to build new schools and health centres and improve the roads.
attributes.additional_details: This government is determined to build houses. It’s a free-for-all where councils don’t have a 5 year supply of housing land. Green fields around communities outside the green belt are targeted by developers. Local resources are overwhelmed, villages swamped. Country roads and junctions can’t cope. Growth should be spread evenly across council areas to avoid disproportionate impact, not concentrated in a few villages. Petition raised by East Leake in Rushcliffe but happening elsewhere too.

attributes.action: Give a mandatory lifetime driving ban for causing death by dangerous driving
attributes.background: Nick Farrimond (35) was killed on the 29th August 2016 by a driver who was convicted and imprisoned for causing death by dangerous driving. He was under the influence of drugs and alcohol. He was also given a ten year driving ban which means he can drive again and could go out and do it again

attributes.action: The option for farm animal sanctuaries to replace ear tags with microchips
attributes.background: Identification ear tags on farm animals for me and many others are a constant reminder of what certain animals are bred for and where they have come from. I have a farm animal sanctuary and all of our animals will be living the rest of their lives at the sanctuary, so ear tags are not necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
Farm animals that are in a sanctuary environment, that will never be entering the food chain nor being rehomed I don't believe need to have ear tags nor slap marks or tattoos for pigs. 
I believe that ear tags are pointless in a sanctuary, they must be extremely annoying, they can get infected, tags are caught and pulled out. I understand the government want a tractability system in place but microchipping will allow all the information that is needed to be on the microchip.

attributes.action: Make boxing safer/ Save lives
attributes.background: Make it the law that all boxing venues must have handheld brain scanners available, to save the lives of amateur and professional boxers and protect families from heartache.

attributes.action: Adapt the education system: lower student exam anxiety whilst saving NHS funds.
attributes.background:
Statistics show growing numbers of students are developing poor mental health (MH.)The education system must be rethought to reduce the pressure placed on the young to lower students' anxiety, improving MH.
This shows the rise in students' with poor MH:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-41148704
attributes.additional_details:
What to do?
Combine teacher assessment, effort levels and academic ability in final grading, lowering students' anxiety as grades won't depend solely on exam performance.
The common misconception that exams are the be-all-and-end-all contributes to the rising stress levels of students, increasing vulnerability to mental illness. 
The financial consequences of treating such preventable illnesses adds to the strain on the NHS. 
Change the education system and enable funds to be better utilised.

attributes.action: Make Legal Aid available for applicants forced to prove immigration status in UK
attributes.background: The Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Act 2012 saw Immigration being taken ‘out of scope’ for legal aid from 01.04.2013. This has affected people forced to prove their Immigration status in the UK, despite living here lawfully, including the Windrush era and their families.
attributes.additional_details: This petition calls on the Government to make Legal Aid available to all applicants who are now forced to prove their Immigration status in the UK and to help them secure confirmation of their entitlement to British citizenship.

attributes.action: Do extra checks in scans during pregnancy to check for vasa previa placentas.
attributes.background: Vasa previa placentas are rare 1:2500 pregnant women have them therefore they do not check for them as standard however detected before labour mum and baby have 99% chance of survival. Undetected if mum goes into labour baby's chance of NOT surviving is between 55-95%.
attributes.additional_details: This is when the vessels that feed the baby oxygen are on the outside of the placenta so when mum dilates and baby's head moves down the vessels burst starving baby of oxygen (with 2mins to get baby out) and causing mum to haemorrhage. Detected, mum will be hospitalised from 29 weeks and have a c section between 35-36 weeks. Undetected results can be devastating. A few extra minutes on a scan could save mum and baby's life.

attributes.action: Make Transplant patients Exempt from paying prescription charges
attributes.background: I have recently learnt after going to renew my exemption certificate that Transplant patients are not exempt despite the amount of drugs they have to take for this life threatening illness. I feel this is wrong when other illnesses such as diabetes are exempt.

attributes.action: Specialist provision for children/adults with Foetal Alcohol Spetrum Disorder
attributes.background: There are thousands of children in the UK who have been diagnosed with Foetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder. Most are being failed by the NHS system, as there are no specialist FASD teams providing proper care.  Many don't fulfil criteria for CAMHS/Paediatric services so have no ongoing care in place.
attributes.additional_details: FASD is a hidden disability that leaves children & young people vulnerable.  The NHS are frequently at a loss to know how to support this condition, with many children & parents left to fend for themselves.  Holistic specialised team for FASD families are needed, with specialised interest in working together to provide therapies and behavioural plans, including psychology, OT, sleep, medical, SALT, trauma, attachment & neurobehavioral (on the lines of Nate Sheets in Oregan).

attributes.action: Investigate the problems faced at the Financial Ombudsman Service
attributes.background: The Ombudsman Service was founded in order to bring fair play to the financial market and to help consumers in need. Under the current leadership the quality of work and training given to investigators is shockingly bad. A new direction needs to be taken by the service to restore faith.
attributes.additional_details: Stress and sick leave have been attributed to the amount of work load being put onto the shoulders of untrained individuals. People have lost faith in the service, both consumers and employees alike have been fobbed off for too long. Many news outlets have commented negatively on the on going changes at the FOS. The only way the general public will see a positive influence by the FOS, is if parliament investigates why the changes have affected people so negatively.

attributes.action: If no agreement on the Ireland Border can be reached, Brexit must be abandoned.
attributes.background: Peace in Northern Ireland is a valuable achievement, given decades of sectarian violence before 1998. No vague promises of benefits on Brexit can compensate for losing this. Allowing for consultation with the other states, if no settlement  by 1 October, we must withdraw Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a major concern for many of us here, and also many in the Irish Republic and the EU, that a `hard border' between the Irish Republic and Northern Ireland will cause serious unrest.

The Good Friday Agreement of 1998 ended the violence and terrorism. but this will return once customs and immigration controls are reimposed. It is reason enough to stop the process of leaving the EU. The safety of the British people is too important to be sacrificed for what is in reality vague promises

attributes.action: For 'Singing on Prescription' to be adopted by the NHS
attributes.background: A growing body of research has found that singing with other people has a positive impact on the health and wellbeing of participants whilst also being a great way to meet and bond with other people, thereby reducing loneliness and isolation, particularly in older people.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.canterbury.ac.uk/health-and-wellbeing/sidney-de-haan-research-centre/documents/singing-for-mental-health-report-dec-2015.pdf
http://rsos.royalsocietypublishing.org/content/2/10/150221
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11811096?access_num=11811096&link_type=MED&dopt=Abstract
http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/1321103X13478862

attributes.action: Ensure all gig economy workers get holiday pay, sick pay, and minimum wage
attributes.background: Hundreds of thousands of gig economy workers miss out on basic rights like holiday pay, sick pay and the minimum wage because of outdated legislation and employment status definitions. We urgently need reform to ensure flexible working doesn’t come at the cost of basic rights.

attributes.action: Make lymph sparing liposuction for lipedema available on the NHS
attributes.background: Lipedema/lipoedema is a fat disorder- affecting around 11% of the female population.  While some ladies are able to get the needed treatment (postcode lottery anyone?), the majority are left out in the cold by the NHS.  The condition is painful and progressive, and these ladies need help.
attributes.additional_details:
Lipedema is quite unknown, and the only known treatment to reduce the fatty build up, is lymph sparing liposuction.  The NHS states this (https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/lipoedema/) but class treatment as cosmetic. 

Untreated, lipedema can then progress and become lipo-lymphema - lymphedema is currently treated with liposuction under the NHS.  Ladies should not have to progress to this stage before they're offered treatment!

Please help us get the treatment we need.

http://www.lipoedema.co.uk/

attributes.action: Tongue Tie to be recognised and made a compulsory check on Newborn Babies.
attributes.background: Tongue Tie can affect around 4-11% of newborns and it's a malformation which restricts the movement of the tongue. It can cause difficulties from a young age and as they grow.  It can cause mothers issues around breastfeeding or terminate breastfeeding like in our case.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son is 15 weeks old had tongue tie up until very recently where we gave in and had a private consultation to have his Tongue Tie divided due to it causing him problems. His bibs were saturated, hasn't gained much weight, couldn't latch onto the teat and pooling milk in his mouth and not swallowing for several sucks. 
It can cause speech & dental problems and the inability to chew solid foods as well as emotional factors. It can cause mums problems like sore/cracked nipples, low milk supply and mastitis. Unfortunately it went unrecognised for 15 weeks in our case even though we pointed it out. It takes just a few seconds to snip and would potentially reduce the amount of appointments and referrals if dealt with early on.
Reference: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/tongue-tie/

attributes.action: Provide Medway funding to build Abbey court special needs secondary school
attributes.background: Abbey court is the only school in medway which caters for profoundly disabled children.There is not enough places at the secondary school due to it being to small and not purpose built for disabled children. We are calling on the government to help fund the build of a secondary school
attributes.additional_details: Abbey court primary moved to a new site in 2017. Medway ran out of money to build the secondary site(land and permission to build is there).Medway stipulated that abbey court primary has to take on ex amount of extra pupils per year, which had now caused there not to be enough secondary spaces therefor our children will be sent out of borough or placed in residential school miles away from loved ones or pulled out of the education system. Every child has a right to education disabled or not

attributes.action: Formally recognize Jerusalem as the capital city of Israel
attributes.background: Given the recent statement from the President of the USA, now would be a good opportunity for the UK to join the USA in recognizing Jerusalem as the Israeli Capital. To resolve the Palestine-Israel issue the UK Gov't must take steps which will pressure both sides to enter into proper negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
Statement by President Donald Trump - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-42259443

Prime Minister May's statement against recognizing Jerusalem as the Israeli Capital - https://www.gov.uk/government/news/pm-statement-on-us-decision-to-move-embassy-to-jerusalem-6-december-2017

Prime Minister Netanyahu's Response to President Donald Trump's Statement -http://www.pmo.gov.il/English/MediaCenter/Spokesman/Pages/spoke_statement061217.aspx

attributes.action: Increase funding & testing of pulmonary fibrosis & idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis
attributes.background: Idiopathic Pulmonary fibrosis is a condition in which the lung tissue becomes thickened, stiff & scarred over a period of time. The lungs lose their ability to transfer oxygen into the bloodstream. As a result, the brain and other organs don’t get the oxygen they need.
attributes.additional_details:
Men are nearly twice as likely as women to suffer from IPF.
There are 5000 new cases of IPF every year in the UK.
50% of IPF sufferers die within 3 years of diagnosis.
More than 30,000 people will be diagnosed with IPF in the EU each year.
IPF is more common than all leukaemias combined. Treatment options for pulmonary fibrosis are limited as the disease is progressive. The prognosis is poor for pulmonary fibrosis. The survival (life expectancy) for most patients is less than 5 years.

attributes.action: Immediately Review the Pubs Code
attributes.background: After 12 years of campaigning, the Pubs Code came in to practice July 2016. It was meant regulate the pubs industry and curb some of the unfair practices carried out by pub owning businesses that negatively affect pub tenants and the wider pub industry. It is not working and urgently needs reviewed.
attributes.additional_details: The Government set a review date of July 2019 to assess the efficacy of The Pubs Code. The failure of the Code has been so catastrophic it is imperative that the Government step in early and strengthen the grey areas of the Code. The simple argument is that an adjudicator has no legal powers, so the cash-rich pub owning companies are simply taking all the significant rulings made by the Pubs Code Adjudicator to the High Court and having them overturned.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords and replace it with an elected upper chamber
attributes.background: Our government is not able to make decisions based on the will of the people because it has to get backing and approval from the House of Lords, an unelected chamber that does not reflect the will of the people. True democracy means that we should be able to vote for all members of parliament.

attributes.action: Stop Ticket Touting and selling tickets above face value
attributes.background:
Ticket touting has to stop. Real fans are waiting an hour early to buy tickets only to be disappointed when all tickets are gone almost instantly. 

Ticket touts are using bots to buy a number of tickets only to sell them for 5x the amount on reseller sites such as Get Me In and StubHub.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand some people cannot make it to the gig and need to sell their tickets but in that case, they do not need to sell above face value. Touts should not be able to sell above face value + any transaction fees. 

To stop this, these reseller sites should be forced by law to only allow tickets to be sold at face value + any transaction fees and then add a small fee so that the site is still profitable. There is no reason for people to be selling tickets above face value even if they cannot attend an event.

Let's get this to parliament and force them to listen. Let's eliminate ticket touts from the industry and let real fans attend gigs again.

attributes.action: Provide short term emergency parking stickers for IBD sufferers.
attributes.background: I’m trying to be a voice for sufferers of Crohn’s and Colitis which are the two forms of inflammatory bowel disease. One of the main symptoms is an urgent need to use the toilet which, due to general poor accessibility to public toilets can often results in unnecessary incontinence.

attributes.action: Low cost path to CITIZENSHIP for all EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status
attributes.background: The Windrush crisis has shown that it is critical to provide fair protection for any of the 3 million law abiding EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status who contribute so much who consider the UK their home and contribute so much to our communities and Britain as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: EU Citizens without British Citizenship make a large net contribution to the UK in economic terms ( https://eu-rope.ideasoneurope.eu/2017/10/30/eu-migrants-give-take/ ) and so many other ways. The Windrush Crisis has shown that there can be no confidence in the promises made by the UK government when it comes to the protection of their rights. It is therefore critical that a low cost and simple path to citizenship is given to EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status.

attributes.action: Reinstate sailing and windsurfing to A level and GCSE PE
attributes.background: Recently sailing and windsurfing have been taken off the list of sports you can be marked on for GCSE and A level PE. Some people started this course unaware of this change.
attributes.additional_details: Sailing and Windsurfing should be reinstated as you have to be physically fit to compete, you can race and it involves refining technique to do well. The UK is an island which mean there are plenty of places for young people to participate in these activities.

attributes.action: Amend the Wildlife Act so companies have to protect wildlife
attributes.background: There's nothing in the Wildlife Act which states that companies must put measures in place to prevent wildlife from being injured/killed whilst they are undertaking outdoor work. We want the Wildlife Act amended in order to reduce the number of animals going to rescues due to the work of businesses.
attributes.additional_details: The Wildlife Act needs to be updated in order to protect all wildlife. Companies have to take responsibility for their actions towards wildlife, for example, putting ramps down holes, covering up all holes, paying the bills of the animals they have injured and so on. By putting this in place, it will help reduce the number of injured or killed wild animals.

attributes.action: Illegal dog fighting - raise the period of imprisonment.
attributes.background: Although illegal, dog fighting and baiting; using dogs and cats is still going on.The maximum sentence for offenders is six months in prison and/or an unlimited fine, but campaigners want it to be raised to up to 3 years.
attributes.additional_details: The Animal Welfare Act 2006  has introduced an important and new concept for pet owners and those responsible for domestic animals. Dog fighting is still going on and proactive action needs to be taken to prevent such crimes, not just reactive action often when animals have been so cruelly killed.
